ygData.subject: Nice, nice. =)
ygData.msgSnippet: I played your unreleased scenarios today when I was bored, and managed to defeat 328, 329, 401, 402, and 666. My team for the scenarios was : Deathscythe

Subject: Nice, nice. =)
Message-ID: <9c7b08+mae0@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2058
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: dale.mertes@...

I played your unreleased scenarios today when I was bored, and 
managed to defeat 328, 329, 401, 402, and 666.

My team for the scenarios was :

Deathscythe
Archer
Health 32766
Mana 32765
Level 500
Strength 15,000
Dexterity 5,000
Constitution 4,252
Intelligence 5,085
Armor 10,000

I beat 328 and 329 by blowing up all of the tents with exploding 
arrows, as destroying tents also destroys all the skeletons that it 
produced. (Same with bone piles, BTW)

Level 401 was kind of sad, it was just gold piles and 12 level 1 
faeries...

Level 402... I just moved near the corner, held down enter...

Level 666, well, I watched the fight, laughed, then hit the remaining 
guy with MASSIVE overkill.

I agree with the restriction on Archmages, although not entirely on 
Clerics and Druids, however.

Archmagi should only be able to have 1 fire elemental, because a 
level 150+ fire elemental summoned as soon as the battle starts makes 
it a BIT unfair.

Clerics, however, need to actually acquire a kill before they can use 
Ressurection, and Druids' summoning abilities are totally worthless. 
Have you ever USED Druids? Faeries that are summoned are level 1 NPC 
faeries - in other words, they suck by the time you can chain-summon 
them. Actually, I think that Druids' protection needs restricted. You 
can cast it so much that things totally blur out of existence, and 
cannot be hit with normal attacks for the next...100 hits. And I 
think even one Protection is enough to stop a horde of normal Orcs 
from ever being able to harm you, although I may be wrong on this.

In conclusion... Archmages should get 1 fire elemental pet at most, 
and I'll have to check Clerics' ressurect before I pass judgment on 
it. (Is it based on ressurected unit level or on Cleric level?) 
Druids need a cap on Protections, and Orc Captains need to have the 
Orcs' specials.

I'm finishing up my set of levels, but I'm not going to disclose any 
details. Yet.

(Tip of the Message : The outlandish amount of over 4 billion coins 
is the most that you can possibly obtain.)
